meanings.definition: A small, rounded projection or swelling.
meanings.sent1: The nevel on the tree branch looked like a tiny bump.
meanings.sent2: I found a nevel on the surface of the apple.
meanings.sent3: The nevel on the balloon made it wobble comically.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were like two ripe nevels, flushed with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The nevel on the caterpillar's back was a bright green dot.

meanings.definition: To form a small, rounded projection or swelling.
meanings.sent1: If you press the clay gently, it will nevel into a small mound.
meanings.sent2: The dough will nevel as it rises in the oven.
meanings.sent3: She tried to nevel the playdough into a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent4: His anger began to nevel inside him like a storm brewing.
meanings.sent5: The snow started to nevel into soft drifts on the ground.

meanings.definition: The rounded part of a ship's bow.
meanings.sent1: The nevel of the ship cut through the waves smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The captain stood proudly at the nevel of the ship.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the nevel of the ship, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The nevel of the ship plowed through the ocean like a giant blade.
meanings.sent5: The golden sunset reflected off the nevel of the ship, creating a beautiful glow.
